channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: DeFi, DAOs and NFTs: Crypto is redefining how charities raise funds
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Crypto donations are so much more than just peer-to-peer Bitcoin and Ether transactions.

item.title: SushiSwap's new DEX aggregator will '10x our market share' — Head Chef
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: SushiSwap’s roadmap for the coming year includes the development of a DEX aggregator, a decentralized incubator, and "several stealth projects."

item.title: Alameda wallet under liquidator control incurred $11.5M in losses: Arkham
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: According to crypto analytics firm Arkham, at least $4 million of these losses were "preventable losses."

item.title: Opinion: The Inter-Blockchain Communication Protocol will end ecosystem maximalism
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Valentin Pletnev
item.description: IBC is going to allow assets to move between blockchains without the high level of risk inherent to bridging.

item.title: CoinFLEX attempts to hose down backlash over proposed new 3AC project
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The pitch deck for the exchange was leaked to the media and had been criticized for involving failed crypto hedge fund Three Arrows Capital.

item.title: EU finance ministers’ group releases statement on political aspects of digital euro
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The Eurogroup confirmed its support for digital euro research and noted that some of the design and use elements under consideration would require political decision making.

item.title: Law Decoded, Jan. 9-16: Gemini, Bithumb, Nexo are fresh targets for regulation and prosecution
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: While the FTX saga continues to make headlines, last week brought a plethora of new troubles for crypto companies in the United States, Europe and Asia.

item.title: Opinion: 2023 is a ‘buidl’ year for crypto gaming
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Corey Wilton
item.description: In 2023, GameFi developers should focus on building out quality more than quantity.

item.title: Nexo sues Cayman Islands financial regulator over VASP license
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The crypto lender claimed that the Cayman Islands Monetary Authority had placed “too much weight” on regulators’ enforcement actions in its decision to deny registration.

item.title: How crypto tokens (but not Bitcoin) will outperform stocks in 2023 — Arca’s CIO explains
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marco Castrovilli
item.description: Some cryptocurrencies will perform better than stocks in 2023 as they become less sensitive to macroeconomic factors, according to Arca’s chief investment officer, Jeff Dorman.

item.title: Seoul government opens city’s metaverse project to public
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: According to Seoul Mayor Oh Se-hoon, the virtual environment will allow residents to access official documents, file complaints, and receive answers to questions on filing taxes.

item.title: 3AC, Coinflex founders collaborating to raise $25M for new claims trading exchange
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: According to the project's pitch deck, the company intends to launch as soon as possible, and estimates the claims market to be worth around $20 billion.

item.title: Bitcoin price breakout or bull trap? 5K Twitter users weigh in
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price may be riding monthly highs, but hardly anyone is sure that the good times are here to stay.

item.title: Binance to let institutions store crypto with cold custody
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: The Mirror service is based on Binance Custody and involves mirroring cold-storage assets through 1:1 collateral held on a Binance account.

item.title: CBDCs not worth the costs and risks, says former BoE advisor
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joseph Hall
item.description: Tony Yates, the former senior adviser of the Bank of England, argues that CBDCs are not worth the headache.

item.title: Monex wants to buy FTX Japan amid bankruptcy proceedings: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Monex CEO, Oki Matsumoto, said it would be a “very good thing” for them if there was less market competition.

item.title: Bitcoin vs Ethereum: Community split between capped supply and deflationary model
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Bitcoin proponents argued that Ether’s monetary policy had changed at least seven times while BTC has seen zero changes.

item.title: Bitcoin could see $25K by March 2023 as US dollar prints ‘death cross’ — Analysis
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: Bitcoin’s price recovery in 2023 has witnessed minimal institutional buying, casting doubt on whether BTC will rally beyond $25,000.

item.title: Iran and Russia want to issue new stablecoin backed by gold
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: The potential stablecoin aims to enable cross-border transactions instead of fiat currencies like the U.S. dollar, the Russian ruble or the Iranian rial.

item.title: Binance, Huobi team up to recover $2.5M from Harmony One hackers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: In a recent tweet, on-chain crypto detective ZachXBT said that the hackers had moved $64 million over the weekend.

item.title: Bithumb ordered to pay outage damages to investors by South Korean court
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: A ruling from local courts has Bithumb liable to pay just over $200,000 in damages to the 132 investors which filed against the cryptocurrency exchange.

item.title: Shiba Inu devs to launch Shibarium L2 network beta
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: While the developers did not give an exact date for the release, the team reiterated that their answer to all questions relating to the time frame is “soon.”

item.title: BTC price cancels FTX losses — 5 things to know in Bitcoin this week
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: The ghost of FTX haunts the crypto industry, but Bitcoin is attempting to leave it behind as BTC price gains endure.

item.title: Cross-border crypto scammers on the hit list for EU agencies
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Europol and Eurojust, two EU agencies for law enforcement cooperation, joined authorities from Bulgaria, Cyprus, Germany and Serbia to investigate online investment fraud since June 2022.

item.title: Nifty News: Price drops on ‘Cryptohouse’ with NFT decor, mint your personality as an NFT and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The owner of the crypto-themed home has dropped its price by over 20% in a few months as they struggle to sell the house.

item.title: Twitter’s crypto price index feature expands to 30 tokens and counting
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Stephen Katte
item.description: Twitter quietly expanded its new crypto price search feature with 30 more cryptocurrencies added to the service.

item.title: Bitcoin steps out of 'fear' for the first time in nine months
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: The Bitcoin Fear and Greed Index reached an index score of 52 over the weekend, marking the first time it's hit neutral territory in three quarters.

item.title: California cannabis producer adopts blockchain to track its weed
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Clones will be certified with a smart contract on the blockchain to verify their authenticity and genetic lineage.

item.title: Tanzania ‘cautious’ on CBDC adoption after initial research
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Stephen Katte
item.description: The Bank of Tanzania is waiting for the conclusion of its research into CBDCs before making a final decision on adoption.

item.title: Google Ads-delivered malware drains NFT influencer’s entire crypto wallet
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: A sponsored advertising link on Google hid malware that siphoned thousands of dollars worth of crypto and NFTs from an influencer’s wallet.
